item.title: Help with HighScores in-game
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111
item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

It could probably be something with this void

public void resetRanks() { for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { server.ranks[i] = 0; server.rankPpl[i] = ""; } }

Or you might have to declare that in your logout packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with HighScores in-game
item.dc:creator: @Maximum_ZxZ Maximum ZxZ
item.description:
@Maximum_ZxZ wrote:

I did my HighScores in-game. It works perfectly but when people log out, there name aren’t ranked anymore and I want the name to stay ranked. How could I do this ?

Here’s my code:

[code]//In-game highscores
public int playerRank = 0;

public void resetRanks() {
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
server.ranks[i] = 0;
server.rankPpl[i] = “”;
}
}

public void highscores() {
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@dbl@", 8144); //Title
sendQuest("@dre@~In-Game Top 10 Highscores~", 8145);
for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { // you also need to change this for it to display more, simply the number you want it to display, say 20 = for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
if(server.ranks[i] > 0) {
sendQuest("@bla@Rank “+(i+1)+”: @red@"+server.rankPpl[i]+ "@bla@ - Total Lvl:@whi@ " +server.ranks[i], 8147+i);
}
}
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
resetRanks();
}
//end highscores[/code]

I got more in client.java again:

[code]//in-game highscores
playerLevel[24] = total;

for (int d = 0; d <= 10; d++) {
    if (total >= server.ranks[d]) {
        if (d == 0) {
            playerRank = d+1;
            server.ranks[d] = total;
            server.rankPpl[d] = playerName;
        }else if (d < 10){
            if (total < server.ranks[d-1]) {
                playerRank = d+1;
                server.ranks[d] = total;
                server.rankPpl[d] = playerName;
            }
        }else{
            if (total < server.ranks[d-1]) {
                playerRank = 0;
            }
        }
    }
}
//end highscores[/code]

Thanks.

Read full topic
